paper_abstract: This paper investigates the impact of the selection of a transversal on the speed of convergence of interval methods based on the non-linear Gauss-Seidel scheme to solve nonlinear systems of equations. It is shown that, in a marked contrast with the linear case, such a selection does not speed up the computation in the general case; directions for researches on more flexible methods to select projections are then discussed.
paper_title: On the selection of a transversal to solve nonlinear systems with interval arithmetic
